intro: Adenosma hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy adenosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Adenosma hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
